p: The present paper aims at an overview of the socioeconomic aspects of the problem of invasive mosquitoes as recorded by the main interest groups in society (citizens and experts). It provides substantive indicators regarding the citizens’ perceived benefit derived from the implementation of improved mosquito control programs, as well as experts’ evaluation of the socioeconomic effectiveness of current and future programs for controlling the problem of invasive mosquitoes. In contrast to other studies [ 17, 38, 39] findings from both perspectives show a higher priority for the prevention and reduction of health risks as opposed to nuisance control.
